channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report X-2025020152
item.description:
Report X-2025020152

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH WITH A PERISHABLE KEEP FROZEN STICKER AFFIXED TO THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SIX POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. INNER FLAP HAD A STICKER STATING DANGER-DRY ICE USE PROTECTIVE GLOVES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1V820A, VANDEMOORTELE, 1005 MAIN ST, PAWTUCKET RI 02860-7802.

item.title: Report X-2025020149
item.description:
Report X-2025020149

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR AND HAD A 1.4 EXPLOSIVE C DIAMOND LABEL. IT HAD SHIPPING PAPERS. DID NOT APPEAR TO BE DAMAGED. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE CHAIN OF COMMAND. RESPONDER CALLED THE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR WHO INSTRUCTED ME TO BRING BACK THE PACKAGE TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
